llm_text:
Why:
- payment_format_ach (value=1) — largest positive driver (SHAP +2.90216); the model strongly increased the flag score because the payment was an ACH.
- amount_received (value=15968.2) — positive driver (SHAP +0.89981); a relatively large received amount contributed to increasing the score.
- dayofweek (value=6) — positive driver (SHAP +0.78160); the transaction occurring on day 6 (Sunday) increased the score.
- amount_paid (value=15968.2) — positive driver (SHAP +0.76414); the paid amount (same numeric value as received) contributed to the increase.
- from_bank (value=908) — negative driver (SHAP −0.92244); the sending-bank feature reduced the flag score, partially offsetting the increases above.

Conclusion:
The model flagged the transaction primarily because it was an ACH transfer (payment_format_ach=1) combined with high amount_received/amount_paid (~15,968.2) and occurring on dayofweek=6 (Sunday), which together raised the score. This increase was partially offset by the from_bank feature (from_bank=908) which lowered the score. If a reviewer focuses on the strongest contributors, they should consider the ACH method, the transaction amount, and the weekend timing as the principal reasons the model labeled this transaction higher risk.
